title: At Least 34 People Killed, 80 Injured In Airstrike On Hospital In Myanmar | 10 News
description: 34 people have been killed and around 80 others injured in an airstrike on a hospital in Myanmar.  The country's military targeted the property in an area controlled by a leading rebel armed force according to local media. title: Rare Violin To Fetch $3.5 Million At Paris Auction | 10 News
description: A 300-year-old artefact is set to go under the hammer in Paris and could fetch more than $3.5 million. title: TikTok Musician Bailey Pickles Teams Up With MrBeast | 10 News+

title: Tom Silvagni Maintains Innocence As Rape Victim Shares Horror Experience | 10 News
description: The famous family of rapist Tom Silvagni has declared they will fight to clear the 23-year-old's name.  Father and Carlton great Stephen Silvagni broke down outside court today, supporting his son, who maintains his innocence.  The woman Tom Silvagni was convicted of raping, delivered a harrowing victim impact statement, describing her attack as calculated and evil. title: Teenage Boy Killed, Multiple Injured In Horror Three-Car Collision In Melbourne’s West | 10 News

title: Australian Tourism To The US Falls Under Trump Presidency | 10 News+
description: Donald Trump’s administration has proposed collecting five years of social media history and bio-metric data from travellers entering the United States, including from Australian citizens.   Graham Turner, the founder of Flight Centre, says the short-term effect will likely be an even steeper fall in Australians travelling to America.   Over the past year, Australian visits to the US have already fallen 6.4%, while travel to elsewhere is up 6.9%. title: Trump Signs Executive Order Restricting US States From Regulating AI | 10 News+
description: US President Donald Trump has made a shocking new move amid his nation’s race for dominance in artificial intelligence.   The commander-in-chief has issued an executive order restricting US states from passing AI regulations.   It stands in stark contrast to calls from members of Congress demanding more government control over the technology.   Professor Toby Walsh, the Chief Scientist at UNSW’s AI Institute, joined 10 News+ to talk about this new development. title: Time Magazine Names ‘Architects Of AI’ As Person Of The Year | 10 News+
description: Time has named its Person of the Year as the ‘Architects of AI’, with the cover featuring the major brains behind the rise of artificial intelligence, including Elon Musk, Mark Zuckerberg, and OpenAI’s Sam Altman.   The magazine says they chose the tech moguls, which also include Nvidia’s Jensen Huang and Anthropic’s Dario Amodei, as they are “delivering the age of thinking machines” which are “wowing and worrying humanity”. title: Dinosaur Fossils The New Trophies For Billionaires And Celebrities | 10 News+
description: Dinosaur fossils are no longer just museum treasures - they've become prehistoric trophies for billionaires and Hollywood celebrities.   There has been a boom in dinosaur fossil auctions, helped by a lack of laws surrounding the field.   In 2024, hedge fund manager Kenneth Griffin spent $60 million for a 150 million-year-old stegosaurus.   Actors Russell Crowe, Nicholas Cage and Leonardo DiCaprio are also among high-profile figures who collect dinosaurs.   Museums often can’t compete financially, which means rare, scientifically valuable fossils sometimes appear briefly for public display, before being privately sold and never seen again. title: Aussies Avoiding US Travel, Dinosaur Skeleton Auction, Time's Person Of The Year | 10 News+
description: Donald Trump’s administration has proposed collecting five years of social media history and bio-metric data from travellers entering the United States, including from Australian citizens. Graham Turner, the founder of Flight Centre, says the short-term effect will likely be an even steeper fall in Australians travelling to America. Over the past year, Australian visits to the US have already fallen 6.4%, while travel to elsewhere is up 6.9%.  US President Donald Trump has made a shocking new move amid his nation’s race for dominance in artificial intelligence. The commander-in-chief has issued an executive order restricting US states from passing AI regulations. It stands in stark contrast to calls from members of Congress demanding more government control over the technology. Professor Toby Walsh, the Chief Scientist at UNSW’s AI Institute, joined 10 News+ to talk about this new development.  Time has named its Person of the Year as the ‘Architects of AI’, with the cover featuring the major brains behind the rise of artificial intelligence, including Elon Musk, Mark Zuckerberg, and OpenAI’s Sam Altman. The magazine says they chose the tech moguls, which also include Nvidia’s Jensen Huang and Anthropic’s Dario Amodei, as they are “delivering the age of thinking machines” which are “wowing and worrying humanity”.  Dinosaur fossils are no longer just museum treasures - they've become prehistoric trophies for billionaires and Hollywood celebrities. There has been a boom in dinosaur fossil auctions, helped by a lack of laws surrounding the field. In 2024, hedge fund manager Kenneth Griffin spent $60 million for a 150 million-year-old stegosaurus. Actors Russell Crowe, Nicholas Cage and Leonardo DiCaprio are also among high-profile figures who collect dinosaurs. Museums often can’t compete financially, which means rare, scientifically valuable fossils sometimes appear briefly for public display, before being privately sold and never seen again.
